perturbation.original_text: 1.8 "Licensed User" and "Licensed Users" means Licensee and Licensee's subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8 "Licensed User" and "Licensed Users" means only Licensee, excluding Licensee's subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: The original text includes Licensee's subsidiaries in the definition of "Licensed User". The changed text explicitly excludes them, creating a contradiction that affects which entities are bound by or benefit from the license agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Licensor hereby grants Licensed Users a nonexclusive, nontransferable, nonsublicensable, royalty-free license, during the term of this Agreement, to use and display the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark in the United States solely in connection with the Licensee's corporate name and identifying mark.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Licensor hereby grants Licensee a nonexclusive, nontransferable, nonsublicensable, royalty-free license, during the term of this Agreement, to use and display the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark in the United States solely in connection with the Licensee's brand name and identifying mark.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants license to 'Licensed Users'. The changed text uses 'Licensee' instead, creating ambiguity on who the license is granted to. Also changed 'corporate name' to 'brand name' which can have slightly different interpretations

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Indemnification. Licensed Users, at Licensed Users' own expense, shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend Licensor, its affiliates, successors and assigns, and its and their directors, officers, employees and agents, against any claim, demand, cause of action, debt, expense or liability (including attorneys' fees and costs), to the extent that the foregoing (a) is based on a claim resulting solely from any service provided or offered by Licensed Users, (b) results from a material breach, or is based on a claim that, if true, would be a material breach, of this Agreement by Licensed Users, or (c) is based upon Licensed Users' unauthorized or improper use of the Licensed Mark.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Indemnification. Licensee, at its own expense, shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend Licensor, its affiliates, successors and assigns, and its and their directors, officers, employees and agents, against any claim, demand, cause of action, debt, expense or liability (including attorneys' fees and costs), to the extent that the foregoing (a) is based on a claim resulting solely from any service provided or offered by Licensee, (b) results from a material breach, or is based on a claim that, if true, would be a material breach, of this Agreement by the indemnifying party, or (c) is based upon the indemnifying party's unauthorized or improper use of the Licensed Mark.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'Licensed Users', while the changed text uses 'Licensee', creating a contradiction in who is responsible for indemnification. Also changed 'Licensed Users' to 'Indemnifying party' in (b) and (c) sections which causes confusion
